humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the metaplastic carcinoma forms a 2.7 x 2.3 x 1.7 cm mass, which is larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage for breast cancer is determined by the greatest dimension of the tumor. In this report, the size of the metaplastic carcinoma is 2.7 x 2.3 x 1.7 cm. The greatest dimension is 2.7 cm, which falls in the T2 category (T2: tumor size >2 cm and ≤5 cm). Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
